text.p: Sunbeam Corp, the struggling appliance maker that recently underwent a massive restructuring, said Tuesday it has signed six new international distributor agreements and rolled out 42 new 220 volt appliances in 10 international regions.
The company also said it had opened four new outlet stores in the past two months. It expects to open 20 outlet stores during 1997.
"New product development and expansion into new markets are key to the rescue plan of the corporation and for igniting Sunbeam's growth," Chairman and Chief Executive Al Dunlap said.

"Currently, only about 15 percent of our total sales are generated outside the United States," Dunlap added. "Our goal is to more than triple our international sales in the next three years through the continued rapid implementation of all our various growth initiatives."
The distributor agreements cover the Philippines, South Africa, Peru, Ecuador, Colombia and Chile. The value of the agreements was not disclosed.
The moves come several months after Sunbeam announced it would cut 6,000 jobs, or about half of its work force, and eliminate 87 percent of its product lines.

The measures were taken in November, about four months after Dunlap became chairman -- and shortly after it reported a third quarter loss of $28.7 million, or $0.22 per share, as sales fell about 2 percent to $244.9 million.
